PERSONA:
meet jamal johnson, a 57-year-old african american man living in omaha, nebraska. raised by a single mother who worked multiple jobs to make ends meet, jamal understands the value of hard work and perseverance. he completed an associate's degree in business administration from a local community college, which helped him secure a job as an office manager at a medium-sized logistics company. 

despite working full-time for over 30 years, jamal's annual income hovers around $28,000. the rising cost of living in omaha's gentrifying neighborhoods has made it difficult for him to get ahead financially. he currently lives with his long-term partner, sheila, a retired nurse, in a modest rental apartment in north omaha, a historically black neighborhood. 

as a liberal democrat and a born-again christian, jamal's political views are shaped by his faith's teachings on social justice and his personal experiences with economic hardship. he is a strong proponent of raising the minimum wage, expanding access to affordable housing, and improving public education in underserved communities. jamal seldom attends religious services but finds solace in his personal relationship with god.

in his free time, jamal enjoys browsing the internet to stay up-to-date on current events and engaging in online discussions on political forums. he is a registered voter and makes a concerted effort to participate in every election, as he believes that exercising one's civic duty is crucial for creating positive change.

while jamal's income may be considered low, his unwavering determination and strong moral compass have instilled in him a deep sense of empathy and a desire to advocate for policies that uplift marginalized communities. he remains hopeful that by using his voice and his vote, he can contribute to building a more equitable society for all.
